body:
**What happened**:

While trying to setup a `kube-controller-manager` outside of the cluster, I had a panic as follow:

```text
I0625 11:36:46.285834    9145 serving.go:313] Generated self-signed cert in-memory
W0625 11:36:46.646110    9145 authentication.go:268] No authentication-kubeconfig provided in order to lookup client-ca-file in configmap/extension-apiserver-authentication in kube-system, so client certificate authentication won't work.
W0625 11:36:46.646150    9145 authentication.go:292] No authentication-kubeconfig provided in order to lookup requestheader-client-ca-file in configmap/extension-apiserver-authentication in kube-system, so request-header client certificate authentication won't work.
W0625 11:36:46.646166    9145 authorization.go:146] No authorization-kubeconfig provided, so SubjectAccessReview of authorization tokens won't work.

        /home/jb/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/cmd/kube-controller-manager/app/core.go:233 +0x313
```

**What you expected to happen**:

Produce an error message as my configuration lacks some options.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): 1.18.4
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: Azure
- Others: 

--cloud-config=
```json
 {
   "subscriptionId": "***-***-***-***-***",
   "resourceGroup": "***",
   "location": "westus2",
   "vnetName": "***",
   "vnetResourceGroup": "***",
   "vmType": "vmss",
   "loadBalancerSku": "standard",
   "useManagedIdentityExtension": false,
   "excludeMasterFromStandardLB": true,
   "cloudConfigType": "file",
   "useInstanceMetadata": false
 }
```

The panics come from https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/934b4150ae526b53eb8a71832c69655d0026bebe/staging/src/k8s.io/legacy-cloud-providers/azure/azure_instances.go#L209  because we exit https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/934b4150ae526b53eb8a71832c69655d0026bebe/staging/src/k8s.io/legacy-cloud-providers/azure/azure.go#L460-L464 as we're not in this case https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/934b4150ae526b53eb8a71832c69655d0026bebe/staging/src/k8s.io/legacy-cloud-providers/azure/azure.go#L384-L389 as the `az.Config.CloudConfigType` is just defaulted-initialised by the caller to `""` here: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/934b4150ae526b53eb8a71832c69655d0026bebe/staging/src/k8s.io/legacy-cloud-providers/azure/azure.go#L317-L327
and effectively assigned afterwards https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/934b4150ae526b53eb8a71832c69655d0026bebe/staging/src/k8s.io/legacy-cloud-providers/azure/azure.go#L452

labels.name: area/provider/azure

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Cloud Provider.
labels.name: sig/cloud-provider

title: [azure] kube-controller-manager panics because of the cloud-config init
